page.title: 20Dedham C of E Primary School
page.content: In our school there are two houses, Constable and Munnings, because they were both local painters. We have 140 children and we all wear school uniform. We attend this school from the age of five to eleven, then we go to a secondary school. We have parties and a Carol Service at Christmas. In the Spring we do plays and concerts. During the Summer we have Speech Day and Open Day. In the Autumn and Winter the boys play football and the girls play netball. In the Summer we all do athletics and play rounders. We have a Head Boy, a Head Girl, House Captains and Prefects. Every Friday afternoon parents come to Assembly. This year the top two classes have all helped with the Domesday Project under the guidance of M.A.& R.H.Knott and Jeremy Parkin who took the photographs.
